title: Calories in a Glass of Champagne
meta_description: Discover calories in a champagne serving, including carbs, alcohol content, per-100 ml basis, and variations for different types.
h1: Calories in a Glass of Champagne
assumptions: Standard 150 ml (5 oz) serving of brut champagne; dry style with low residual sugar; no added mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, sweetness level (brut, extra dry, etc.), serving size, and any added ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One 150 ml glass of brut champagne contains ~105 kcal, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Extra dry style (higher sugar) per glass

faqs.q: How many calories in a champagne glass?
faqs.a: About 105 kcal for a standard 150 ml brut champagne.
Yes, ~2.3 g carbs per glass, mainly residual sugars; brut is lower.

faqs.q: Is champagne low-calorie compared to other wines?
faqs.a: Similar to dry wines at ~70 kcal per 100 ml, but sweetness increases calories.
Sugar content (brut vs sweet), serving size, and mixers like juice or syrup.
Approximately 70 kcal for brut; scales with volume and style.
